metadata.title: CVE-2020-12400 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
When converting coordinates from projective to affine, the modularinversion was not performed in constant time, resulting in a possibletiming-based side channel attack. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 80and Firefox for Android < 80.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12400` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss3 - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
libnss3-1d - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
libnss3-nssdb - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
libnss3-tools - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
No subscription required

firefox - 80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nss package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.13').
firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
